description: First time using browser on TV
id: User is able to enable Firefox Sync the first time the browser is open
instructions:
1. On TV go to Browser menu
>> Welcome Firefox screen is shown
>> There are options to Sign in or Skip
2. Tap on Skip
>> Browser main view is open
3. Tap on Sign in
>> Firefox account menu is shown
4. Go through the log in process
>> User is able to log in succesfully
>> A success screen is shown with an OK button
5. Tap on Ok
>> Browser settings screen is shown
>> Firefox Sync account appears with the correct options

description: Firefox Account user should be an already Firefox Sync user that has been enabled before on desktop or android
id: User can enable Firefox Sync whe there is not any Firefox Account user logged yet
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu
>> Browser settings screen is shown
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown
3. Complete Firefox Accounts flow with an existing Firefox Sync user
>> Browser settings screen is shown showing the Firefox Account used
>> Options to Sync Now and Sign Out are shown
>> Collections appear with Bookmarks selected by default

description: User has not enabled Sync before on Desktop or Android
id: User cannot enable Firefox Sync if the user has not enabled Sync on Desktop or android before
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu
>> Browser settings screen is shown
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown
3. Complete Firefox Accounts flow with an NOT existing Firefox Sync user
>> This account is inactive message is shown
4. Tap on OK
>> Browser setting screen is shown 
>> Firefox Sync Sing In button is active

description: User has not verified his/her Firefox Account yet
id: User cannot enable Firefox Sync with an unverified Firefox Account
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu
>> Browser settings screen is shown
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown
3. Introduce a NOT existing Firefox Account
>> Unknown account message is shown
4. Tap on Ok
>> Browser settings screen is shown
>> Firefox Sync Sign In button is enabled

id: User can logout and login with a different account
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu
>> Browser settings screen is shown
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown
3. Introduce a n existing Firefox Account used enabled in Sync
>> Log in is successful
4. On Firefox Sync menu, enable History collection
>> History is synced
5. Check both History and Bookmarks synced
>> Both History and Bookmarks are the correct one for the user logged in
6. Sign out from Firefox Sync
>> User is logged out
7. Sign in wih a different account
>> Bookmarks are shown correctly according to the Firefox sync user logged in
>> History is shown correctly according to the Firefox sync user logged in

description: The device has not enabled data or Wi-Fi connection
id: User should be notified that network connection is needed to start using the app
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu
>> Browser settings screen is shown
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown
3. Introduce a n existing Firefox Account used enabled in Sync
>> There should be an error message letting user know that network connection is needed

description: Firefox Account already exists
id: User should get a warning when the password is incorrect
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu 
>> Browser settings screen is shown 
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync 
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown 
3. Introduce a valid Firefox Account but an invalid password
>> Invalid password screen is shown
4. Tap on OK
>> Enter your password screen is shown

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can disable Data Sync
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu
>> Browser settings screen is shown
2. On Firefox Sync section, tap on Sign Out
>> There is a warning message giving the option to Sign Out or to Cancel
3. Tap on Sign Out
>> A message letting user know that he had signed out is shown
4. Tap on OK
>> Browser settings menu is shown, no Firefox Sync account appears
>> Firefox Sync Sign In button is enabled

id: User can see if he is logged in in Firefox sync or not in Browser menu options
instructions:
1. Open browser and tap on its menu button
>> Among the options there is Sign in to Sync
2. Tap on Sing in to Sync and complete the flow to log in
>> User is successfully logged in
3. Open browser menu again
>> Among the options it should appear the Firefox Account used for Firefox Sync instead of Sign in to Sync option

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can see the initial status of the Firefox Sync app
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its settings menu 
>> Browser settings screen is shown 
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync 
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown 
3. Complete Firefox Accounts flow with an existing Firefox Sync user 
>> Browser settings screen is shown showing the Firefox Account used 
>> HIstory and Bookmarks collections appear
>> Bookmarks is selected by default

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can enable history collection
instructions:
1. Open browser and go to its menu 
>> Browser settings screen is shown 
2. Tap on Sign in to Sync 
>> Firefox Account Sign in screen is shown 
3. Complete Firefox Accounts flow with an existing Firefox Sync user 
>> Browser settings screen is shown showing the Firefox Account used 
>> HIstory and Bookmarks collections appear
>> Bookmarks is selected by default
4. Tap on history collection and then on Sync now
>> Please enter your password screen is shown ** Only if user does not low the privacy level, then this screen will not be shown
5. Enter the password and tap on OK
>> Browser settings screen is shown with both Bookmarks and History collections enabled

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can disable collections
instructions:
1. Open browser and tap on its menu -> settings
>> Browser settings screen is shown showing the Firefox Account used 
>> HIstory and Bookmarks collections appear
>> Bookmarks is selected by default
4. Tap on history collection
>> Please enter your password screen is shown ** Only if user does not low the privacy level, then this screen will not be shown
5. Enter the password and tap on OK
>> Browser settings screen is shown with both Bookmarks and History collections enabled
6. Disable both collections
>> Sync now button should be disabled
7. Enable both collections
>> Password screen is shown so that user can enable again both collections

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can check the Terms of Service and Privacy
instructions:
1. On browser setting screen go to Terms of Service
>> Should open a window and browse to: https://accounts.firefox.com/legal/terms
>> ??? If no connection, the network error dialog should be shown.

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can check the Privacy Note
instructions:
1. On browser setting screen go to Terms of Service
>> Should open a window and browse to: https://accounts.firefox.com/legal/privacy
>> ??? If no connection, the network error dialog should be shown.

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can close Terms of Service and Privacy window
instructions:
1. On browser setting screen go to Terms of Service
>> Should open a window and browse to: https://accounts.firefox.com/legal/terms
2. Go back
>> Browser main page is shown

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can see when the Sync can be done, it is being done
instructions:
1. On browser settings tap on Sync Now
>> Button label changes to Syncing

description: Firefox Sync has been enabled on the device
id: User can Sync to get his/her collections updated
instructions:
1. On browser settings check the status of Sync now button
>> If there is at least one collection selected, it is enabled
>> If all collections are unselected the button should be disabled

description: User has been logged with Firefox Account and enabled Firefox Sync on the device
id: User can see the account he is using for Firefox Sync
instructions:
1. Tap on Browser settings menu button
>> Among the options as user is already logged it should appear his account instad of Sign in to Sync
2. On browser settings check the Firefox Sync account shown
>> It should appear the Firefox Account mail used for log in

description:
Sync has been enabled in Desktop or Android.
User is logged with Firefox Account in the device
id: User can see the history for the enabled Sync account when logging in the device
instructions:
1. Open browser settings menu and tap on History
>> History should be empty, no Synced folder should appear
2. On Firefox Sync tap on History Collection to enable it
>> Please enter your password screen is shown
3. Enter the correct password
>> Firefox Sync menu is shown with History enabled
4. Open browser menu and tap on History option
>> This history shown is the correct one for the Sync user logged in

description:
Sync has been enabled in Desktop or Android.
User is logged with Firefox Account in the device and has used Firefox Sync already
id: User can see the new history entries when Syncing on the device
instructions:
1. Open the browser and go to Firefox Sync 
>> Firefox Sync menu is shown correctly
2. Open History and check it is synced correctly
>> The history should be the same than in browser
3. On desktop browser go to a web site
>> That web site is shown in its hisory
4. Go to Firefox Sync again and tap on Sync Now button
>> Sync button changes to Syncing and the button is greyed
5. Open Browser on TV and check the history
>> The last entry on desktop history should be shown"

description: User is logged in in Firefox Sync
id: User can enable or disable the collections
instructions:
1. In browser settings menu enable History
>> The checkbox can be marked
2. Tap on Sync
>> History is updated
3. In browser settings menu disable History
>> The checkbox is disabled
4. Tap on Sync
>> History is NOT updated

description: Syn enabled in desktop and there are some history saved for a user.
id: User can remove the history from desktop
instructions:
1. In browser settings menu enable History
>> The checkbox can be marked
2. Tap on Sync
>> History is updated
3. On desktop remove all history
>> The history for sync user is now empty
4. On TV browser got to Sync and tap on Sync now
>> History should be empty

description: User is logged in in Firefox Sync and using Sync on desktop or android
id: User can see a maximum of 20 history entries in the device
instructions:
1. On TV browser open History
>> There should be 500 entries maximum

description: There are history synced
id: User can move on Bookmarks menu
instructions:
1. On browser main view, tap on Menu > History option
>> Device history list is shown
>> There should be a Synced History folder
2. Tap on Synced History folder
>> The history synced is shown
>> There is an option to go back

description: User is logged in in Firefox Sync and using Sync on desktop or android having there several bookmarks
id: User can see his bookmarks stored in desktop on the TV
instructions:
1. Sign in to Sync
>> The log in has been done successfully
2. On browser main view tap on Bookmark option
>> Synced bookmarks folder....
>> Same bookmarks that can be seen in Desktop for Sync user

description:
User is logged in in Firefox Sync and using Sync on desktop or android having there several bookmarks
User has at least 201 bookmarks stored
id: User can see a maximum of 200 bookmarks
instructions:
1. Sign in to Sync
>> The log in has been done successfully
2. On browser main view tap on Bookmark option
>> Synced bookmarks folder....
>> Same bookmarks that can be seen in Desktop for Sync user
3. Open Synced bookmarks
>> All bookmarks should appear

description: User is logged in in Firefox Sync and using Sync on desktop or android having there several bookmarks
id: User can update his bookmarks to have the latest saved in desktop
instructions:
1. Open the browser and go to Firefox Sync 
>> Firefox Sync menu is shown correctly
2. Open Bookmarks and check it is synced correctly
>> The bookmarks should be the same than in browser
3. On desktop browser go to a web site and mark it as bookmark
>> That web site is shown in its bookmarks list
4. Go to Firefox Sync again and tap on Sync Now button
>> Sync button changes to Syncing and the button is greyed
5. Open Browser on TV and check the Bookmarks
>> The last bookmarked site in desktop should be shown

description: User is logged in in Firefox Sync and using Sync on desktop or android having there several bookmarks
id: User can remove the saved bookmarks
instructions:
1. Open the browser and go to Firefox Sync 
>> Firefox Sync menu is shown correctly
2. Open Bookmarks and check it is synced correctly
>> The bookmarks should be the same than in browser
3. On desktop browser remove all bookmarks
>> Bookmarks list is empty
4. Go to Firefox Sync again and tap on Sync Now button
>> Sync button changes to Syncing and the button is greyed
5. Open Browser on TV and check the Bookmarks
>> Bookmarks have been removed

description: There are bookmarks synced
id: User can move on Bookmarks menu
instructions:
1. On browser main view, tap on Bookmark option
>> Bookmarks list is shown
>> There should be a Synced Bookmarks folder
2. Tap on Synced Bookmarks folder
>> The bookmarks synced are shown
>> There is an option to go back
